title: How can scientists tell which genes cause certain traits? - Quora

response.answer_text: The first step is determining association by studying heredity i.e. show that a trait has the inheritance pattern you’d associate with one or more genes (and environmental factors). This only shows you that a gene may be responsible; it gives you no information as to which gene. You can, at this stage, assign a name to the gene which might make you feel you’ve “identified it” but you haven’t really. Next step is to look for genetic differences associated with the trait - a tedious process of gene sequencing and comparison. You can get some idea of what to look for as a short cut if you know of a difference in proteins associated with the condition - for example, sickle cell disease - as this gives you a specific gene sequence to target with your sequencing/probes.
